title: NSquare Sum ( Medium )
text:
Given Q pairs of integers Ni, Ai (1 ≤ Ai, Q ≤ 105, 4 ≤ N ≤ 100), find Ni numbers whose square sums is equal to Ai. If there're more than one solution, print the one lexicographically smallest. If there's no solution, print "Impossible".Q = 1
Ni = 4
A1 = 16
{ 42+ 02+ 02+ 02= 16}InputThere's an integer Q (1 ≤ Q ≤ 105) in the first line; it stands for the number of queries. The next Q lines describe each query with two integers Ni, Ai (1 ≤ Ai ≤ 105, 4 ≤ Ni ≤ 100). Ni is the number of integers that you need to find whose sum of squares is equal to Ai.OutputYou have to print Q lines, each one with Ni numbers such that the sum of squares is equal to Ai. If there's no solution, you've to print "Impossible".ExampleInput:1
4 16Output:0 0 0 4Input:1
4 15Output:1 1 2 3
